string.text: Pick up your stash and everything in it
Interval between nearby-object scans, in milliseconds. Smaller values will update more frequently.
Interval between the more-intensive faraway-object scans, in milliseconds. Smaller values will update more frequently, but may have a performance cost.

Radius of the nearby-object scan in meters. Many things are based on this value, such as the distances at which markers fade out and scale up/down. It is recommended that you don't adjust this value, or do so in very small increments.

Radius of the faraway-object scan in meters, which is used to detect objects before they come into visual range. This also determines the distance at which the system cleans up markers that are no longer needed. \n \nThis is measured from the end of the near scan radius, but higher values may have a performance cost, and there is no benefit to setting them more than about 5m higher than the near radius.
Increase perception radius based on Skill System
Name of the skill used for this check
Scan radius multiplier per skill level

If Skill System integration is enabled, this setting controls the multiplier that is applied to the near scan radius per skill level, and effectively increases the player's "perception" range--within which dot markers can appear. \n \nAt Scavenging level 15 with the default multiplier of 0.5 and radius of 3, the final near scan radius would be 10.5m.
If you are reporting a problem, turn this on and generate a clean log that shows the problem happening.
When reporting a problem please also enable this. It will ensure that the log contains the most detailed troubleshooting information.
If enabled, the interaction dots themselves will be hidden, but the interaction UI will still be available.
Hide the custom primary interact UI
If enabled, the custom primary interact UI added by DotMarks will not be shown. The primary vanilla "use" function and prompts will still work normally.
Hide the custom secondary interact UI
If enabled, the custom secondary interact UI added by DotMarks will not be shown, and secondary interactions will not be available.

If enabled, any vanilla interact prompts (the text at the bottom of the screen) will be hidden if they have been replaced by a custom version. \n \nThis setting has no effect if the custom primary interaction UI is also hidden.
If enabled, will hide the white line connecting the dot to the interact prompt.
Show alt use UI during FDDA animations
Alt use disabled during FDDA animations

If enabled, the secondary interact UI will still be shown during FDDA animations, and the next setting below controls whether it can be used. If you want to hide the prompt entirely during animations, disable this option.

If this option is enabled, the secondary interact UI is disabled during FDDA animations, dimming and showing a "Too Busy" message until the current animation completes.
 
 
Disabling this option will allow "animation canceling", skipping the current animation and immediately beginning the next. The sound effects will still play.
These settings adjust the positions of the interact prompts. These are canvas coordinates, which are 1024x768--not your screen resolution. Some may require a restart to take effect.
Adjust the prompt's position horizontally. Allowed values are -512 to 1024. \n \nDefault: -10
Adjust the prompt's position vertically. Allowed values are -384 to 768. \n \nDefault: 28
Adjust the prompt's position horizontally. Allowed values are -512 to 1024. \n \nDefault: -10
Adjust the prompt's position vertically. Allowed values are -384 to 768. \n \nDefault: 48

If this option is enabled, the custom interaction prompts will have a fixed screen position based on the offsets above, and the offsets are measured relative to the upper-left corner of the screen. 
 
By default, the prompts follow the position of their attached dotmark, and their offsets are measured from the position of that dot. 
 
You must restart/saveload your game for this setting to take effect.
Sets the alpha (transparency) channel for the main drop shadows underneath the interaction prompts or other UI elements. Set to zero to disable the main drop shadows.
Sets the visual style for the graphical "key" icons used as backgrounds for the keybind text on interaction prompts, or disables the backgrounds entirely.

This slider adjusts the size of the dot markers added to objects in the world. A value of 1 is their default intended size, while zero will hide these icons entirely. Other features of this addon, such as the text labels or secondary interaction, will not be affected.
Hide items marked as junk in Sorting Plus
If the Sorting Plus addon is installed, and an item has been marked as "junk", then a mark will not be shown for it.
Hidden items still show interaction prompts

If a marker is hidden using for any reason, its interaction prompts will still be shown. \n \nNOTE: If this option is not enabled, hidden markers will not have any visible interaction prompts at all. This will not prevent you from picking them up if you want to, it just won't show the prompt.
Dead stalkers use PAW faction patches
If my Personal Adjustable Waypoint addon (PAW) is installed, this option will cause dead stalkers to show their faction patch instead of the dot marker icon.
Disables the subtle UI "blip" sound effect that plays when cycling the mouse wheel or during other similar events.
Body markers obey Milspec PDA rules
If my Milspec PDA addon is installed, this option will obey that addon's visibility settings for dead bodies--which will only show a marker on bodies whose map markers are visible to the player.
Disable special icon for explosive objects
If this option is enabled, explosive objects will use the standard dot marker instead of their special "I explode" icon.
Disable special icon for breakable boxes
If this option is enabled, breakable boxes will use the standard dot marker instead of their special "breakable object" icon.
Disable special icon for talking to NPCs
If this option is enabled, stalkers will use the standard dot marker instead of swapping to their special "speech bubble" icon when their primary interaction prompt is shown.
Disable special icons for service NPCs
If this option is enabled, service NPCs will use the standard dot marker instead of swapping to their service-specific icon when their primary interaction prompt is shown.
If this option is enabled, doors will use the standard dot marker instead of swapping to their special "door" icon when their primary interaction prompt is shown.
The duration, in milliseconds, of the fade-in effect for interaction prompts.
The duration, in milliseconds, of the fade-out effect for interaction prompts.

If enabled, a small display will be shown beside the primary interaction prompt, showing its weight and value and (optionally, with Utjan's addon) indicator dots for the condition of weapon/armor parts.

If enbabled, the condition of weapons, outfits and headgear will be appended to the name of the item.\n
\nThis option is disabled by default in GAMMA, which does not use item condition.
If enabled, the battery charge of devices will be appended to the name of the item.
If enabled, the color of the condition/battery text will change based on the value.
Show icon for favorites/junk on the item card
If enabled, items marked as Favorites or Junk with Sorting Plus will display the appropriate icon on the item card.
Some fonts will look better at different resolutions due to the inconsistent way Anomaly sizes the text. The default for the prompt text is Letterica 16, but choose whichever one looks best to you.
Font used for the Item Card

Some fonts will look better at different resolutions due to the inconsistent way Anomaly sizes the text. The default for the Item Card is the Small Print font, but choose whichever one looks best to you. \n \nThe addon tries to adjust the UI based on the size of the text, but it may be necessary to adjust screen position values for the Item Card or other elements when using some fonts.

The Item Card is an optional info window attached to the prompt that shows vital data such as an item's weight and value, as well as integrating with other addons such as Sorting Plus and Utjan's Item UI Improvements.
Changes the size of the icons in the Item Card, used for attributes such as Weight and Value. \n \nDefault: 7.5
Adjusts the amount that the Item Card's position is horizontally offset. \n \nDefault: -9.5
Adjusts the amount that the Item Card's position is vertically offset. \n \nDefault: 2

Adjusts the horizontal offset for the part condition dots added by Utjan's Item UI Improvements addon. This position is measured relative to the end of the primary text prompt. Enabling or disabling the dots themselves is a setting controlled in Utjan's MCM menu. \n \nDefault: -7

Adjusts the vertical offset for the part condition dots added by Utjan's Item UI Improvements addon. This position is measured relative to the end of the primary text prompt. Enabling or disabling the dots themselves is a setting controlled in Utjan's MCM menu. \n \nDefault: -4

Adjusts the horizontal offset for the Favorite/Junk icons added by Sorting Plus. This position is measured relative to the right end of the Item Card, which is based on the length of the longest text field: Weight or Value. \n \nDefault: 10

Adjusts the vertical offset for the Favorite/Junk icons added by Sorting Plus. This position is measured relative to the right end of the Item Card, which is based on the length of the longest text field: Weight or Value. \n \nDefault: 1

$clr_whtIf you need to report a problem or crash:
 
$clr_cmg1. $clr_whtTurn on $clr_gldboth debug and verbose$clr_wht logging below 
$clr_cmg2. $clr_whtExit the game and restart it 
$clr_cmg3. $clr_whtReproduce the issue $clr_gldas quickly and simply as possible 
$clr_cmg4. $clr_whtExit $clr_gldimmediately$clr_wht and send me the log


$clr_redIf you don't do this or can't reproduce the issue, I probably can't help you.

If you need to report a problem or crash: 
1. Turn on both debug and verbose logging below 
2. Exit the game and restart it 
3. Reproduce the issue as quickly and simply as possible 
4. Exit immediately and send me the log


If you don't do this or can't reproduce the issue, I probably can't help you.

Welcome to Interaction Dot Marks--a modernized replacement for the object interaction UI that brings some of Stalker 2's QoL features back to Anomaly, while adding powerful new options. Everyone enjoys different things, so DotMarks is designed to be customized to your preferences. If you don't find what you're looking for in the options below, head over to the Advanced tab.

$clr_whtWelcome to $clr_gldInteraction Dot Marks$clr_wht--a modernized replacement for the object interaction UI that brings some of Stalker 2's QoL features back to Anomaly, while adding powerful new options.\n \nEveryone enjoys different things, so DotMarks is designed to be $clr_lblcustomized to your preferences$clr_wht. If you don't find what you're looking for in the options below, head over to the $clr_lblAdvanced$clr_wht tab.

$clr_redWARNING: Your modded binaries are out of date!
 
$clr_whtInteraction Dot Marks $clr_gldrequires modded binaries 20250306 or newer$clr_wht in order to function properly. Before attempting to use this addon, perform a clean installation of the latest demonized modded binaries:
 
https://github.com/themrdemonized/xray-monolith

$clr_redWARNING: You are not running modded binaries!
 
$clr_whtInteraction Dot Marks $clr_gldrequires modded binaries 20250306 or newer$clr_wht in order to function properly. Before attempting to use this addon, perform a clean installation of the latest demonized modded binaries:
 
https://github.com/themrdemonized/xray-monolith

$clr_whtHere you can enable or disable $clr_gldInteraction Dot Marks$clr_wht for different types of objects, as well as object-specific settings.\n
\n$clr_gldIf you make changes here, they may not take effect for already-scanned objects until you move away from them or saveload.

$clr_gldAdvanced Settings
 $clr_whtYou probably won't need most of the following settings, but they're here for those who want to customize the UI exactly to their liking.
 
Scroll down for many more options than you see here.

$clr_gldOther Addon Support\n $clr_whtDotMarks supports multiple other addons, such as Sorting Plus, Utjan's Item UI, Milspec PDA, PAW, and more. Some of these integrations have options which you can adjust here.

$clr_whtThe following checkboxes $clr_gldcontrol whether visible dot markers are added$clr_wht to each different class of object. If any are distracting or less useful for you, unchecking them here will hide their markers. You can still interact with the objects normally.

$clr_whtThe $clr_gldsecondary interact$clr_wht allows context-sensitive actions when targeting marked objects without needing to pick them up first--such as removing the ammo from a weapon, or consuming food items. FDDA Redone is strongly recommended.\n
\nBy default it is set to a long-press version of your primary interact (your "use" key), but you can change it here to whatever is most convenient.
When enabled, the number of uses in a multi-use item will be displayed beside the prompt, if more than one remains.

When enabled, if there is more than one nearby item that can be picked up, scrolling the mouse wheel will cycle focus through the nearby items instead of its usual function.\n
\nIf FDDAR's multi-pickup option is disabled, DotMarks will try to respect this by only allowing the focused item to be picked up, but that isn't always possible.

When a long-press (hold) action is completed, inputs from that same key will be ignored for this many milliseconds. This is to prevent the same key from incorrectly registering as a simple press just after releasing the key.\n
\nIf you find that pressing your primary interact to pick up an item isn't registering, you can try lowering this value. It must be betweem 50 and 2000.

When using a secondary action on a pickup item, this is the delay in seconds between the pickup event and the secondary action.\n
\nWhen using FDDA, this is necessary in order to allow the pickup animation time to begin. This setting should have no effect without FDDA installed.
